snippet: The Malaysian government introduced a new law in Parliament on Tuesday that would limit detentions of people suspected of terrorism or security offenses to 28 days.
abstract: Malaysian government introduces legislation to limit the time it can detain people suspected of security-related offenses without formal charges to 28 days, replacing a law allowing for indefinite detention; it is the latest in a series of moves toward improved civil liberties by Prime Min Najib Razak as elections approach.
lead_paragraph: The Malaysian government introduced a new law in Parliament on Tuesday that would limit detentions of people suspected of terrorism or security offenses to 28 days.

headline.seo: Malaysian Government Proposes Ending Indefinite Detentions
headline.main: Malaysia Weighs End to Indefinite Detention
